Comment: A lot of people think Project 2025 is just Trump world scrambling after losing 2020, but the truth is way bigger. This plan has been decades in the making.  The Heritage Foundation, a hard-right think tank founded in 1973, has been working on this since before Reagan. In 1981, they dropped the first "Mandate for Leadership," basically a manual for how to gut and remake the federal government. Reagan used it. Every Republican president since has pulled from it. Project 2025 is just the newest rebrand of the same agenda.  It is technically "nonpartisan," but it is packed with former Trump officials and MAGA loyalists. The goal? Make sure the next conservative president can fire huge chunks of the federal workforce, eliminate whole agencies, and stack the government with loyalists on day one. It is not just about Trump — it is about locking in minority rule for decades.  Bottom line: Project 2025 isn’t new. It is the result of a 50-year campaign to permanently shift power to the far right. If people don’t take it seriously, they are sleepwalking into an authoritarian future.  TL;DR: Project 2025 isn’t just a Trump thing. It’s the result of a 50-year conservative plan by the Heritage Foundation to take over and reshape the federal government permanently.

Comment: You have no rights as an American if you undermine the constitution which you are. I mean if you want to “secure the border”, go ahead. I’m fine with the government spending money on that but I don’t think it reduces the incentives for migrants to come illegally. Also, no due process means there is no vetting if somebody is a citizen or not before removal—hence you aren’t protected and you can be shipped off to El Salvador. I’m pointing out areas where there was a breakdown in reforms because those reforms are needed. Literally, everyone is essentially ready to sit down and pass reforms through congress but the current admin hasn’t done anything regarding immigration in the Congress even though he could likely pass whatever he wants.  I’m not sure if you’d believe me if I told you this is largely red meat for the base. I’ll give you the policies you want as long as they are constitutional, but funnily enough the politicians you believe in won’t pass them because they benefit from their exploitation. The best thing for republicans is to make sure this problem never ends and they always can be seen as the ones trying to solve it, but the “evil democrats are preventing them to buy votes”. It’s just sad, because there is so much stuff that is more important and you are falling for pure grift.   In my view, the country ends when you end the constitution and we will be essentially 50 countries until we are reconstituted since the authority the created the government is no longer valid/legitimate. I don’t know why you are so insistent that the only way to end illegal immigration is to end the constitution and therefore the republic.

Author: zffjk

Comment: No one thinks he should have been handed the nomination. Seems like you may not have been paying attention during that time but a lot of very shady things happened and the DNC absolutely coordinated efforts for him to lose:  * Bernie was in first place going into Super Tuesday.  * The left wing media started a 24/7 smear campaign about how he couldn't win. * Just before ST all the candidates besides Warren and Biden dropped out, including Pete who was running in 2nd place.  * Warren stayed to split the progressive vote and everyone else endorsed Biden even though he wasn't even close to ranking at that point.  * Left wing media harps 24/7 on how only Biden can win and smears Bernie further by saying he's sexist without providing receipts.  * Day of ST many polling places that leaned towards Bernie (some in lower income areas where transportation is difficult) are inexplicably closed with no notice. This was announced only on Twitter just hours beforehand. People were showing up to vote and seeing notices of relocated areas far away from them.   Yeah, no foul play there...
Author: squirrelux
